alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Chowan; Gates; Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Bertie, southeastern Northampton, Hertford, western Gates and northwestern Chowan Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms over Aulander, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ahoskie, Rich Square, Aulander, Gatesville, Ryland, Gates, Woodland, Winton, Lewiston Woodville, Cofield, Powellsville, Roxobel, Colerain, Harrellsville, Tyner, Roduco, Rockyhock, Union, Kelford and Goose Pond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
